title: Grouping satellite bands by spectral and spatial resolution
text: want analysis based raster data obtained satellite area municipality Lanjarón Granada (Spain). cover area, downloaded two satellite band files ESA website. S2A_MSIL2A_20230905T105621_N0509_R094_T30SVF_20230905T170700.zip: 0.91 GB S2A_MSIL2A_20230905T105621_N0509_R094_T30SVG_20230905T170700.zip: 1.14 GB case, area small requires two files, can decompress one one unzip tool. can also use sat_untarzip() function package: decompresses indicated list files files included given folder. unzipped directly folder (esa folder), creating two subfolders. order reduce size can included package, additionally selected transformed original raster files, grouping using terra::aggregate() function factor 100. result following folders: esa/f: 751 KB esa/g: 842 KB folders included package. directly contain raster files transformed according previous description. can access shown .
code: sat_untarzip("download/esa", out_dir = "esa") f <- system.file("extdata", "esa/f", package = "satres") g <- system.file("extdata", "esa/g", package = "satres")

title: Grouping satellite bands by spectral and spatial resolution
text: merge satellite bands corresponding geographical area (tiles) classify according spatial resolution, create object satres class. pass parameter folder files located. can also indicate work folder parameter, virtual rasters created; none indicated, temporary folder used. default, satellite spectral bands (B01 B12) considered. setting only_spectral_bands parameter FALSE, can indicate raster files included folders cover area interest also treated, shown code . case need bands (B01 B12), obtain data stored package.
code: sr_all <- satres(dir = esa, only_spectral_bands = FALSE) esa <- system.file("extdata", "esa", package = "satres") sr <- satres(dir = esa)

title: Grouping satellite bands by spectral and spatial resolution
text: Next consult spatial resolution result (remember changed resolution, adding factor 100). obtain object class SpatRaster terra package bands indicated spatial resolution. show available bands, represent graphically .  bands directly accessible name (B02, B03, B04 B08 figure), within object obtained result. way can obtain objects levels spatial resolution. case going show names bands. can save results disk using functions terra package. can also save directly using save_by_resolution() function, stores file names obtained based spatial resolution. example, only_show_files parameter controls execution function displays file names.
code: sr |>   get_spatial_resolution() #> [1] "r1000m" "r2000m" "r6000m" r1000m <- sr |>   as_SpatRaster("r1000m") terra::plot(r1000m) r2000m <- sr |>   as_SpatRaster("r2000m") names(r2000m) #>  [1] "B01" "B02" "B03" "B04" "B05" "B06" "B07" "B11" "B12" "B8A"  r6000m <- sr |>   as_SpatRaster("r6000m") names(r6000m) #>  [1] "B01" "B02" "B03" "B04" "B05" "B06" "B07" "B09" "B11" "B12" "B8A" sr |>   save_by_resolution(out_dir = "esa/out", only_show_files = TRUE) #> [1] "esa/out/r1000m.tif" "esa/out/r2000m.tif" "esa/out/r6000m.tif"

title: Selecting and transforming satellite bands
text: data going use vignette Grouping satellite bands spectral spatial resolution, vignette("satres"): Two compressed files bands Sentinel-2 satellite (obtained ESA website) covering municipality Lanjarón Granada (Spain) , unzipped, added factor 100 (data resolution multiplied 100) included package. access folders contain using following function calls: also going work vector layer polygons outline municipality Lanjarón, also included package GeoPackage format. access file using following function call:
code: esa <- system.file("extdata", "esa", package = "satres") esa_f <- system.file("extdata", "esa/f", package = "satres") esa_g <- system.file("extdata", "esa/g", package = "satres") lanjaron_gpkg <- system.file("extdata", "lanjaron.gpkg", package = "satres")

what: Creation of objects of the satres class
title: Selecting and transforming satellite bands
text: create object need indicate folder contains satellite band files. default, satellite spectral bands (B01 B12) considered. want available bands included, indicate using only_spectral_bands parameter, shown . cases, since files contained folder (regardless deep folder structure), rasters tiles work area merged. way, can create independent objects folders. case, going consider spectral bands.
code: sr <- satres(dir = esa) sr_all <- satres(dir = esa, only_spectral_bands = FALSE) sr_f <- satres(dir = esa_f) sr_g <- satres(dir = esa_g)

title: Selecting and transforming satellite bands
text: can see results obtained far consulting available spatial resolutions (objects) obtaining objects class SpatRaster, shown . band names available resolution. Firstly, case considered spectral bands, considered bands. see differences objects, object, going show one bands resolution.    previous images can see first raster result fusion two following rasters.
code: sr |>   get_spatial_resolution() #> [1] "r1000m" "r2000m" "r6000m"  r_1000m <- sr |>   as_SpatRaster("r1000m")  r_all_1000m <- sr_all |>   as_SpatRaster("r1000m")  r_f_1000m <- sr_f |>   as_SpatRaster("r1000m")  r_g_1000m <- sr_g |>   as_SpatRaster("r1000m") names(r_1000m) #> [1] "B02" "B03" "B04" "B08"  names(r_all_1000m) #>  [1] "AOT"            "B02"            "B03"            "B04"            #>  [5] "B08"            "MSK_DETFOO_B02" "MSK_DETFOO_B03" "MSK_DETFOO_B04" #>  [9] "MSK_DETFOO_B08" "WVP" terra::plot(r_1000m[["B02"]]) terra::plot(r_g_1000m[["B02"]]) terra::plot(r_f_1000m[["B02"]])

title: Selecting and transforming satellite bands
text: First, query bands available spatial resolution; next, select bands spatial resolutions need.

title: Selecting and transforming satellite bands
text: previous section used get_spatial_resolution() function obtain available spatial resolutions. show . can consult bands available one spatial resolutions. default obtained available resolutions, can see . Similarly, can also limit query available spectral bands, shown .
code: sr_all |>   get_spatial_resolution() #> [1] "r1000m" "r2000m" "r6000m" sr_all |>   get_band_names(res = "r1000m") #>  [1] "AOT"            "B02"            "B03"            "B04"            #>  [5] "B08"            "MSK_DETFOO_B02" "MSK_DETFOO_B03" "MSK_DETFOO_B04" #>  [9] "MSK_DETFOO_B08" "WVP"  sr_all |>   get_band_names() #>  [1] "AOT"            "B01"            "B02"            "B03"            #>  [5] "B04"            "B05"            "B06"            "B07"            #>  [9] "B08"            "B09"            "B11"            "B12"            #> [13] "B8A"            "MSK_CLDPRB"     "MSK_DETFOO_B01" "MSK_DETFOO_B02" #> [17] "MSK_DETFOO_B03" "MSK_DETFOO_B04" "MSK_DETFOO_B05" "MSK_DETFOO_B06" #> [21] "MSK_DETFOO_B07" "MSK_DETFOO_B08" "MSK_DETFOO_B09" "MSK_DETFOO_B10" #> [25] "MSK_DETFOO_B11" "MSK_DETFOO_B12" "MSK_DETFOO_B8A" "MSK_SNWPRB"     #> [29] "SCL"            "WVP" sr_all |>   get_spectral_band_names(res = "r1000m") #> [1] "B02" "B03" "B04" "B08"  sr_all |>   get_spectral_band_names() #>  [1] "B01" "B02" "B03" "B04" "B05" "B06" "B07" "B08" "B09" "B11" "B12" "B8A"

title: Selecting and transforming satellite bands
text: know spatial resolutions available bands, can generate new satres object selecting using select_bands() function. parameters indicated, default considers available values, shown following examples.
code: sr_sel1 <- sr_all |>   select_bands(res = c("r2000m", "r6000m"),                bands = c("B01", "B02", "B03")) sr_sel1 |>   get_spatial_resolution() #> [1] "r2000m" "r6000m" sr_sel1 |>   get_band_names() #> [1] "B01" "B02" "B03"  sr_sel2 <- sr_all |>   select_bands(bands = c("B01", "B02", "B03")) sr_sel2 |>   get_spatial_resolution() #> [1] "r1000m" "r2000m" "r6000m" sr_sel2 |>   get_band_names() #> [1] "B01" "B02" "B03"

code: sr2 <- sr_f |>   merge_tiles(sr_g) terra::plot(r_1000m[["B02"]]) r2_1000m <- sr2 |>   as_SpatRaster("r1000m") terra::plot(r2_1000m[["B02"]]) sr |>   get_spatial_resolution() #> [1] "r1000m" "r2000m" "r6000m" sr |>   get_band_names() #>  [1] "B01" "B02" "B03" "B04" "B05" "B06" "B07" "B08" "B09" "B11" "B12" "B8A"  sr2 |>   get_spatial_resolution() #> [1] "r1000m" "r2000m" "r6000m" sr2 |>   get_band_names() #>  [1] "B01" "B02" "B03" "B04" "B05" "B06" "B07" "B08" "B09" "B11" "B12" "B8A"

title: Selecting and transforming satellite bands
text: objective obtain merge bands study area municipality Lanjarón. can clip rasters using polygon represents area interest. case, going use polygon defines outline municipality. described section [“Datos”][Datos], included file GeoPackage format package, whose name lanjaron_gpkg variable. read GeoPackage layer need, shown . perform clipping operation, polygon can CRS, CRS maintained raster layers. show result, obtain object class Z display one raster layers along vector layer used clip , can seen .  raster layer coarse granularity transformation performed able store package. show bands available selected spatial resolution, represent graphically .
code: lanjaron <-   sf::st_read(lanjaron_gpkg, layer = "lanjaron", quiet = TRUE) sr_lanjaron <- sr |>   clip_bands(polygon = lanjaron) r_lanjaron_1000m <- sr_lanjaron |>   as_SpatRaster("r1000m")  terra::plot(r_lanjaron_1000m[["B02"]]) terra::plot(sf::st_geometry(lanjaron), add = TRUE) terra::plot(r_lanjaron_1000m)

what: Grouping Satellite Bands by Spectral and Spatial Resolution
title: Grouping Satellite Bands by Spectral and Spatial Resolution
text: frequently download files satellite bands ESA USGS websites perform data analysis, transform store DBMS. downloaded files ZIP TAR format. cases, necessary download several files cover study area, first operation perform merge bands. access bands explicitly indicate name location files. goal satres (satellite spectral spatial resolution) partially automate operations. enough indicate folder contains decompressed files: Satellite bands automatically obtained name (spectral) spatial resolution; several files cover geographical area, corresponding bands automatically merged. result can stored disk can also obtained objects class SpatRaster, package terra. Currently supports files obtained following sources characteristics: Landsat 8-9 OLI/TIRS C2 L1 (Landsat 8-9 Operational Land Imager Thermal Infrared Sensor Collection 2 Level-1). Landsat 7 ETM+ C2 L1 (Landsat 7 Enhanced Thematic Mapper Plus Collection 2 Level-1). Landsat 4-5 TM C2 L1 (Landsat 4-5 Thematic Mapper Collection 2 Level-1). Sentinel-2 MSI S2MSI1C (Sentinel-2 Multi Spectral Instrument Level-1C). Sentinel-2 MSI S2MSI2A (Sentinel-2 Multi Spectral Instrument Level-2A).

title: Grouping Satellite Bands by Spectral and Spatial Resolution

code: install.packages("satres") devtools::install_github("josesamos/satres")

S2A_MSIL2A_20230905T105621_N0509_R094_T30SVF_20230905T170700.zip: 0.91 GB S2A_MSIL2A_20230905T105621_N0509_R094_T30SVG_20230905T170700.zip: 1.14 GB unzipped directly folder, creating two subfolders. Additionally, selected transformed original raster files, grouping using terra::aggregate() function factor 100, reduce size can included package. result following folders: esa/f: 751 KB esa/g: 842 KB merge satellite bands corresponding geographical area (tiles) classify according spatial resolution, create object satres class. pass parameter folder files located. Next consult spatial resolution result (remember changed resolution, adding factor 100). obtain object class SpatRaster terra package bands indicated spatial resolution. show available bands, represent graphically .  bands directly accessible name (B02, B03, B04 B08 figure), within object obtained result.

title: satres 1.1.0
text: Transformation vignette. Functions transform object: clip_bands(), select_bands(), merge_tiles(). Functions query object: get_band_names(), get_spectral_band_names(). Change satres() parameter only_bands only_spectral_bands avoid ambiguity.
